comments: Discriminant of Chebyshev polynomial T_n (x) of first kind.
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 795.
Theodore J. Rivlin, Chebyshev polynomials: from approximation theory to algebra and number theory, 2. ed., Wiley, New York, 1990; p. 219.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
Index entries for sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials.
formula: a(n) = (n^n)*2^((n-1)^2), n>=1, a(0):=0.a(n) = ((2^((n-1)^2))*Det(Vn(xn[1],..,xn[n])))^2, n>=1, with the determinant of the Vandermonde matrix Vn with elements (Vn)i,j:= xn[i]^j, i=1..n,j=0..n-1 and xn[i]:=cos((2*i-1)*Pi/(2*n)), i=1,..,n, are the zeros of the Chebyshev T(n,x) polynomials.a(n) = ((-1)^(n*(n-1)/2))*(2^((n-1)*(n-2))) * product(diff(T(n,x),x)|_{x=xn[i]},i=1..n), n>0, with the zeros xn[i],i=1..n, given above.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
